item.title: Perfect competition and the creativity of the market
item.description: Makowski, L.; Ostroy, J. M. The complete theory of competition cannot be known because it is an open-ended theory; it is always possible that a new range of problems will be posed in this framework, and then, no matter how well-developed the theory was with respect to the earlier range of problems, it may require extensive elaboration in respects which previously it had glassed over or ignored.
